### Instructions:

Use the `hr` schema from [Oracle Live SQL](https://livesql.oracle.com/) to complete the following exercises.

![](images/clipboard-2759979999.png)

1.  Log in and click `Start Coding` as screenshot below.

![](images/clipboard-633559056.png)

2.  Click on `SQL worksheet`

![](images/clipboard-2871069976.png)

3.  Start solving the questions below by typing in the SQL code in the editor. Remember to prefix your table name with `hr.table_name` to represent the table is from `hr` schema.

### Section 1: Easy

1.  Retrieve the first name and last name of all employees.

2.  List all distinct job IDs from the employees table.

3.  Retrieve the first name and last name of all employees, sorted by last name in ascending order.

4.  Find all employees who work in department 50.

5.  Find all employees whose first name starts with 'J'.

### Section 2: Intermediate

6.  Find all employees who work in departments 10, 20, or 30.

7.  Find all employees who work in department 50 and have a salary greater than 5000.

8.  Count the number of employees in department 50.

9.  Calculate the total salary of all employees in department 50.

10. Calculate the average salary of employees in department 50.

### Section 3: Hard

11. Count the number of employees in each department.

12. Find departments with more than 3 employees.

13. Retrieve the top 5 highest paid employees.

14. List all employees along with their department names.

15. Find employees who earn more than the average salary.

### Section 4: Challenge

16. Retrieve employees along with their department names and job titles.

17. Find employees who work in the 'Sales' department.

18. List all departments and the number of employees in each department, including departments without employees.

19. List all employees and the number of employees in their departments, including employees without a department.

20. Find departments with more than 5 employees and list the department names and employee counts.
